channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Local meteorologists could face layoffs amid new initiative with The Weather Channel
item.description: The new initiative will be rolled out across 27 stations and feature "additional visual storytelling capabilities," Allen Media Group says.
item.content:encoded:
The new initiative will be rolled out across 27 stations and feature "additional visual storytelling capabilities," Allen Media Group says.

(Image credit: Chance Yeh)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump rallies at Capital One Arena in preview of inauguration
item.description: Trump took the rally as an opportunity to preview several of his Day 1 actions, including on border security, energy, and ending the Biden administration's diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts in government agencies.
item.content:encoded:
Trump took the rally as an opportunity to preview several of his Day 1 actions, including on border security, energy, and ending the Biden administration's diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts in government agencies.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Social Videos: Far from the front lines, Ukrainians fight a war to preserve their culture
item.description: In the Transcarpathia region, some locals embrace a traditional lifestyle and cultural identity. After surviving Soviet threats, now they fear Russian President Vladimir Putin seeks to erase their culture.
item.content:encoded: In the Transcarpathia region, some locals embrace a traditional lifestyle and cultural identity. After surviving Soviet threats, now they fear Russian President Vladimir Putin seeks to erase their culture.
item.dc:creator: Catie Dull

item.title: Heavy snow and frigid temps put 70 million in the U.S. under winter storm warnings
item.description: Residents along the East Coast, from the Northern Plains to the tip of Maine, are bracing for several inches of snow on Sunday followed by dangerously cold temperatures.
item.content:encoded:
Residents along the East Coast, from the Northern Plains to the tip of Maine, are bracing for several inches of snow on Sunday followed by dangerously cold temperatures.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: TikTok is back online in the U.S., following Trump's promise to pause the ban
item.description: The president-elect said he will issue an executive order Monday to delay the ban while he brokers a sale. The app has returned on web and mobile, but is not available in Apple and Google's stores.
item.content:encoded:
The president-elect said he will issue an executive order Monday to delay the ban while he brokers a sale. The app has returned on web and mobile, but is not available in Apple and Google's stores.

(Image credit: Ashley Landis)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Joe Biden's complicated legacy
item.description:
When he ran for office in 2020, President Joe Biden vowed to turn the page on then president Donald Trump. But it's Trump who is returning to the White House for a second term in office.

We speak with NPR's Asma Khalid, who covered the Biden administration, on the legacy he leaves behind.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
When he ran for office in 2020, President Joe Biden vowed to turn the page on then president Donald Trump. But it's Trump who is returning to the White House for a second term in office.

We speak with NPR's Asma Khalid, who covered the Biden administration, on the legacy he leaves behind.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)

item.title: Biden pardons Virginia House Speaker Don Scott, Black nationalist Marcus Garvey
item.description: President Joe Biden pardons five people and commutes the sentence of two others who "made significant contributions to improving their communities."
item.content:encoded:
President Joe Biden pardons five people and commutes the sentence of two others who "made significant contributions to improving their communities."

(Image credit: Steve Helber)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Why Trump's tariff promises will be hard to keep
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has said his tariffs will raise revenues, boost U.S. jobs, and help stop the drug trade. But some of these goals are at odds with the others.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump has said his tariffs will raise revenues, boost U.S. jobs, and help stop the drug trade. But some of these goals are at odds with the others.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: 3 freed hostages arrive in Israel as tenuous ceasefire with Hamas holds
item.description: Romi Gonen, Emily Damari and Doron Steinbrecher crossed into Israel on a military transport after being driven out of Gaza City in a Red Cross vehicle, Israel said.
item.content:encoded:
Romi Gonen, Emily Damari and Doron Steinbrecher crossed into Israel on a military transport after being driven out of Gaza City in a Red Cross vehicle, Israel said.

(Image credit: Gil Cohen-Magen)
item.dc:creator: Jerome Socolovsky

item.title: Steve Bannon says MAGA populism will win â€” as Trump is surrounded by billionaires
item.description: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon says he doesn't believe the president-elect will listen to "tech oligarchs" over the right-wing populist movement that helped him secure another White House term.
item.content:encoded: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon says he doesn't believe the president-elect will listen to "tech oligarchs" over the right-wing populist movement that helped him secure another White House term.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep
